summary: This document is a series of pages from the Florida Sexual Offender and Predator registry for Jeffrey E. Epstein. It details his registration information, criminal charges, addresses, vehicles, email addresses, and other personal data as maintained by the Florida Department of Law Enforcement. This document is a series of screenshots from the Florida Sexual Offender and Predator registry for Jeffrey E. Epstein. It contains his registration details, photographs, travel notifications, address verifications, and internal comments from law enforcement regarding his status, movements, and compliance between 2008 and 2019. This document appears to be a printout from a Florida law enforcement sex offender registry database for Jeffrey Epstein, showing his status as 'Released' and containing field information updates from officers regarding his incarceration and scheduled release date. It includes contact information for law enforcement personnel and notes about Epstein's status. This document is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) Sexual Predator/Offender Registration Form for Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated January 3, 2019, with a certification copy dated January 14, 2019. It includes a duplicate registration from December 2018. The form details Epstein's personal information, addresses, vehicles, employment, and the extensive legal obligations he must follow as a registered sexual offender in Florida. This document is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) Sexual Predator/Offender Registration form for Jeffrey E. Epstein, signed on December 18, 2018. It details his legal obligations as a registered sexual offender, including his registration details, addresses, vehicles, and travel plans. The document is certified by an FDLE records custodian on January 14, 2019. This document is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) Sexual Predator/Offender Registration form and accompanying certification, detailing the legal obligations and specific registration information for Jeffrey E. Epstein. It includes his acknowledgment of the requirements, his personal details, addresses, vehicles, and travel plans as of late 2018. This document is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) Sexual Predator/Offender Registration Form for Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated November 2018. It details his registration obligations as a sexual offender, including his personal information, addresses, employment, and travel. The form is certified by an FDLE records custodian in January 2019. This document is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) Sexual Predator/Offender Registration Form for Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated November 16, 2018. It details his registration obligations, personal information, vehicles, and addresses, including his permanent address in the U.S. Virgin Islands and a temporary address in Palm Beach, Florida. The document is certified by an FDLE records custodian. This is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) Sexual Predator/Offender Registration form for Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated July 2018. It details his registration obligations, personal information, vehicles, and includes a certification by a records custodian. The form indicates his next re-registration was scheduled for January 2019. This document is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) Sexual Predator/Offender Registration Form for Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated January 4, 2018. It includes his personal details, addresses, vehicles, and a detailed notice of his legal obligations as a registered sexual offender in Florida. The document is certified by an FDLE records custodian. This is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) sex offender registration form for Jeffrey E. Epstein, detailing his registration obligations, personal information, and vehicles. It confirms his status as a registered sex offender in Florida with specific reporting requirements.

connections.description: Indyke communicates travel plans and delays on behalf of Epstein to law enforcement, indicating a legal representation relationship.
Pinney, as a registration program manager, is the official point of contact for Epstein's travel notifications to the U.S. Virgin Islands.
W. Epstein sends an email to authorities advising of Jeffrey Epstein's travel delay, suggesting a close personal or professional association.
Wheeler, an FDLE analyst, requests detailed monitoring reports on Epstein's whereabouts and status during his incarceration/work release.
Carpenter is listed as a contact/agency in the sex offender registry for Epstein, indicating a law enforcement monitoring relationship.
Wood is listed multiple times as a contact/agency in the sex offender registry for Epstein, indicating a law enforcement monitoring relationship and possibly multiple interactions.

events.title: Criminal Adjudication
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was adjudicated for the charge of 'Procuring A Person Under The Age Of 18 For Prostitution' under Florida Statute 796.03.

events.title: Sex Offender Registration
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's information, including his criminal charge, was added to the Florida Sexual Offender and Predator registry.

events.title: Court Order on Confidentiality
events.description: A United States District Court order prohibited the FDLE from disclosing the identity of a sexual offender/predator registrant associated with email addresses or internet identifiers, except to law enforcement.

events.title: Epstein Conviction
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted on one count of Solicitation of Prostitution (FS 796.03) and sentenced to 6 months in the Palm Beach County jail.

events.title: Scheduled Release from Jail
events.description: Epstein was scheduled to be released from the Palm Beach County jail on July 22, 2009, after which he would be on probation.

events.title: Delayed Travel to Virgin Islands
events.description: Epstein's planned travel from his Palm Beach, Florida vacation home to his permanent residence in the U.S. Virgin Islands was delayed by one day.

events.title: Further Travel Delay
events.description: An email from W. Epstein advised authorities that Jeffrey Epstein's trip was delayed and he remained at his Palm Beach residence.

events.title: Diligent Search Completed
events.description: A diligent search was completed and mailed in relation to a request from Roy Wright with the U.S. Marshals Service in New York.

events.title: Status Update Accepted
events.description: A status update for Jeffrey Epstein was accepted into the sex offender registry system.

events.title: Multiple Status Updates Accepted
events.description: Multiple status updates for Jeffrey Epstein were accepted into the sex offender registry system on this date.

events.title: Status Update Accepted
events.description: A status update for Jeffrey Epstein was accepted into the sex offender registry system.

events.title: Scheduled Release from Jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was scheduled to be released from Palm Beach County Jail on this date.

events.title: Epstein's Sexual Offender Registration
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein submits an FDLE Sexual Predator/Offender Registration Form, providing his personal details, addresses, vehicles, and employment information as required by Florida law.

events.title: Previous Sexual Offender Registration
events.description: A prior registration form from December 2018 is included in the certified documents, indicating Epstein was registering at that time as well.

events.title: Certification of Registration Documents
events.description: An FDLE records custodian certifies that the attached registration forms for Jeffrey Epstein are true and accurate copies of records received and kept in the regular course of business.

events.title: Epstein's Sexual Offender Registration

events.title: Certification of Epstein's Registration Documents
events.description: An FDLE records custodian certifies that the attached registration documents for Jeffrey Epstein are true and accurate copies of official records.

events.title: Epstein's Temporary Stay in Palm Beach
events.description: Epstein reports he will be at a temporary address in Palm Beach, Florida, from December 5 to December 10, 2018.

events.title: Epstein Signs Sexual Offender Registration Acknowledgment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signs the 'NOTICE OF SEXUAL PREDATOR AND SEXUAL OFFENDER OBLIGATIONS' form, acknowledging he has read and understands the extensive registration requirements.

events.title: Epstein's Temporary Residence in Florida
events.description: Epstein reports traveling from another state to establish a temporary residence in Florida from November 14 to November 24, 2018, staying at a temporary address in Palm Beach before returning to his permanent address.

events.title: FDLE Certification of Epstein's Registration Documents
events.description: FDLE Senior Crime Intelligence Analyst L. Ward swears and certifies that the attached Epstein registration documents are true and accurate copies of records received and kept by FDLE.

events.title: Epstein Sexual Offender Registration Submission
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein submits a sexual offender registration form to the Florida Department of Law Enforcement, providing updated personal information and addresses.

events.description: The Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) received and recorded sexual predator/offender registration forms for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Sex Offender Registration Acknowledgment

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as a 'Released' sex offender in the Florida registry, adjudicated for procuring a person under 18 for prostitution.
The registry lists numerous addresses for Epstein, including properties in the U.S. Virgin Islands, Palm Beach (FL), New York City, Paris, and New Mexico.
Epstein was associated with multiple email addresses, including jeffrey@jeffreyepstein.org and jeffreyepstein@live.com.
The document notes a court order restricting the public disclosure of sex offenders' email and internet identifiers.
Epstein's victim information lists a female, age 14, as a minor.
Jeffrey Epstein was a registered sex offender in Florida, convicted in 2008 for solicitation of prostitution.
Epstein established a permanent residence in the U.S. Virgin Islands while maintaining an address in Palm Beach, Florida.
Epstein's attorney, Darren Indyke, formally communicated changes to Epstein's travel plans between Florida and the Virgin Islands to law enforcement officials.
Internal registry comments show law enforcement tracking Epstein's movements, work release at the Florida Science Foundation, and responding to public records requests.
The registry record includes multiple photographs of Epstein taken between 2008 and 2013.
Jeffrey Epstein's status in the Florida sex offender registry is listed as 'Released'.
Epstein was incarcerated at the Palm Beach County Jail with a scheduled release date of September 24, 2009.
The document shows multiple law enforcement contacts (Edwin Carpenter and Lawrence Wood) associated with monitoring Epstein's status.
Several status updates were accepted into the registry system between June and July 2009 regarding Epstein's case.
Jeffrey Epstein is registered as a sexual offender in Florida, with a registration number 1139651 and person number 73274.
Epstein reported multiple addresses including a permanent address in Palm Beach, Florida, and temporary addresses in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands.
Epstein listed his employer as 'Financial Trust Company' at an address in St. Thomas, with a start date of July 26, 2012.
The document outlines extensive and strict legal obligations for Epstein, including frequent in-person reporting to sheriffs' offices, with failures constituting felonies.
Epstein reported owning vehicles including a 2013 Ford Expedition and a 2008 Land Rover Range Rover, and a 2011 vessel.
Jeffrey Epstein was a registered sexual offender in Florida as of December 2018, with a registration number of 1134005/1131507 and person number 73274.
Epstein's permanent address was listed as 8100 Red Hook Quarters Ste B3, St Thomas, US Virgin Islands 00802.
Epstein reported a temporary address at 358 El Grillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida, for a stay from December 5 to December 10, 2018.
The registration form lists vehicles owned by Epstein, including a 2013 Ford Expedition and a 2008 Land Rover Range Rover.
The document is officially certified by the Florida Department of Law Enforcement as a true copy of his registration records.
Jeffrey Epstein was a registered sexual offender in Florida, legally obligated to comply with extensive reporting requirements for life.
Epstein's registration form lists a permanent address in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, and a temporary address in Palm Beach, Florida, for November 2018.

The document certifies that Epstein's registration information, including his vehicles (a 2013 Ford Expedition and a 2008 Land Rover) and email addresses, was reported to and maintained by the Florida Department of Law Enforcement.
Epstein was required to re-register twice a year, specifically in January and July, with his next re-registration due in January 2019.
The form details severe penalties, including felony charges, for failure to comply with any of the registration obligations, such as reporting address changes, internet identifiers, or travel plans.
